title: Unfairly banned
body:
Hey guys,

On Thursday I logged on for a game before Uni and after I chose my champion I was alerted to a message that I had been banned. The email I received said I had been permanently banned for the use of a third party program. 

I have used a custom skin changer in the past, other than that I have no idea what the reason would be. I have received two responses from riot:

https://gyazo.com/00c63f5550c0e9d7840996f5a21450f6

 https://gyazo.com/39890c9628de270bb055cab21a79f4d3

So I am getting told I was caught using an exploit, when I know for sure I haven't been. I have had my account since early 2012 - not something I would ever risk for something so stupid. 

Has this happened to anyone else before? And more importantly does Riot ban users permanently and without warning for a custom skin changer.

replies.body: nobody can know the truth. you could be lying or riots system could be not working as expected. anything can be considered by riot as an unauthorised program. maybe the custom skins for your game actually helped with your gameplay. you might know this, or you dont. maybe the program or the programmers you got the skins from started making exploits and riots banning anyone at all thats dealt with the program or the programmers unique code

Maybe re-title your post as, 
fairly banned don't download third party programs as they can get you banned for exploitation.
Me posting on forums twice about this ban that was completely fair, did not change the outcome at all.


-also I am sorry if you did get banned just for a skin changer but I mean, like IAkeno said, you took the risk and paid the price

I get that using one is at my own risk, but they are telling me that I was benefiting from the use of an exploit. To me, that wording means that I have been caught using something that has given me an advantage over over players.
benefit of visuals, every single person in that game might have extremely distracting sparkly effects on their attacks, but custom skins can remove that and an unfair clarity advantage.

> [{quoted}](name=Talon12,realm=OCE,application-id=Ntey9fRZ,discussion-id=yLayvJA5,comment-id=000100000000,timestamp=2016-04-23T13:16:11.569+0000)
>
> benefit of visuals, every single person in that game might have extremely distracting sparkly effects on their attacks, but custom skins can remove that and an unfair clarity advantage.

Custom skins only apply to yourself and no one but you can see them.
exactly. And a lot of custom skins have reduced particles, giving the person using them increased clarity and therefore an advantage.

Well guys, I now have no idea at all why my account is banned:
http://postimg.org/image/z8pxxkxw7/

To me it looks like I have been banned for no reason at all. This sucks :/

Maybe the skin changer thing is not authorized by riot. There has been at least 3 people that I know this week who had the same problem. Please do contact riot about this via support ticket if you have any questions. I believe they won't unban your account however. Sorry about that =(. Next time if you ever get a new account please DO NOT use any 3rd party program and take the risk.
Yeah man, I would not risk it again, just didn't think using custom skins would ever get me banned tbh as it is only cosmetic and not altering the way the game is played out :(
Please contact riot for this. Hopefully just hopefully they would give you a second chance. I hope the best man {{sticker:slayer-pantheon-thumbs}}
